sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Problemys of olde siknesse and figures Whiche p[ro]uyd been fructuous of sentens and haue auctorities grounded on scripture by resemblance of notable apperannce [sic] with moralities concludynge on prudence. Chorle and the birde Lydgate, John, 1370?-1451?
[9] leaves
[Emprentyt by me Richard Pinson], [London] : [1493]
Attributed to John Lydgate. Signatures: a6 B4. Title from opening words of text. Printer's name from colophon; date of publication from STC. Signature collation from Duff. In verse. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
